dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 511 IH: Power And Security Systems (PASS) Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Welch (for himself and Mrs. Brooks of Indiana) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To provide for consideration of the extension under the Energy Policy and Conservation Act of nonapplication of No-Load Mode energy efficiency standards to certain security or life safety alarms or surveillance systems, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Power And Security Systems (PASS) Act.

section.header: Extension of nonapplication of No-Load Mode energy efficiency standard to certain security or life safety alarm or surveillance systems

subsection.text: Section 325(u)(3)(D)(ii) of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6295(u)(3)(D)(ii)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 2015 each place it appears and inserting 2021; and

subsection.text: Section 325(u)(3)(E) of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (42 U.S.C. 6295(u)(3)(E)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking July 1, 2017, and inserting the effective date of the amendment under subparagraph (D)(ii); and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: In the rule under subparagraph (D)(ii) and subsequent amendments the Secretary may treat some or all external power supplies designed to be connected to a security or life safety alarm or surveillance system as a separate product class or may extend the nonapplication under clause (ii).
